sn44.7:1.1.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahāmoggallānena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.7:1.1.eng: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.7:1.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.7:1.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to Mahāmoggallāna:

sn44.7:2.1.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, sassato loko”ti?
sn44.7:2.1.eng: “Worthy Moggallāna, is this right: ‘the cosmos is eternal’?”

sn44.7:2.2.eng: “Vaccha, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.7:2.4.eng: “Then is this right: ‘the cosmos is not eternal’ …

sn44.7:2.7.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, antavā loko”ti?

sn44.7:2.13.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran”ti?
sn44.7:2.13.eng: ‘the soul and the body are identical’ …

sn44.7:2.16.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho moggallāna, aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran”ti?
sn44.7:2.16.eng: ‘the soul is one thing, the body another’ …

sn44.7:2.19.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.7:2.19.eng: ‘a realized one still exists after death’ …

sn44.7:2.22.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho moggallāna, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.7:2.22.eng: ‘a realized one no longer exists after death’ …

sn44.7:2.25.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.7:2.25.eng: ‘a realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death’ …

sn44.7:2.27.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.7:2.28.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho moggallāna, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
sn44.7:2.28.eng: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death’?”

sn44.7:2.29.eng: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sn44.7:2.30.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.7:3.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bho moggallāna, hetu ko paccayo, yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti—
sn44.7:3.1.eng: “What’s the cause, worthy Moggallāna, what’s the reason why, when the wanderers of other religions are asked these questions, they declare one of these to be true?

sn44.7:3.2.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā, antavā lokoti vā, anantavā lokoti vā, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīranti vā, aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīranti vā, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā?

sn44.7:3.3.pli: Ko pana, bho moggallāna, hetu ko paccayo, yena samaṇassa gotamassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti—
sn44.7:3.3.eng: And what’s the reason why, when the ascetic Gotama is asked these questions, he does not declare one of these to be true?”

sn44.7:3.4.pli: sassato lokotipi, asassato lokotipi, antavā lokotipi, anantavā lokotipi, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīrantipi, aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīrantipi, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇātipi, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇātipi, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇātipi, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇātipī”ti?

sn44.7:4.1.pli: “Aññatitthiyā kho, vaccha, paribbājakā cakkhuṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti …pe…
sn44.7:4.1.eng: “Vaccha, the wanderers of other religions regard the eye like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’ They regard the ear … nose …

sn44.7:4.2.pli: jivhaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti …pe…

sn44.7:4.3.pli: manaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti.
sn44.7:4.3.eng: mind like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’

sn44.7:4.4.pli: Tasmā aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti—
sn44.7:4.4.eng: That’s why, when asked, they declare one of those answers to be true.

sn44.7:4.6.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā.

sn44.7:4.7.pli: Tathāgato ca kho, vaccha, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho cakkhuṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…
sn44.7:4.7.eng: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha regards the eye like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ He regards the ear … nose …

sn44.7:4.8.pli: jivhaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…

sn44.7:4.9.pli: manaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.
sn44.7:4.9.eng: mind like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn44.7:4.10.pli: Tasmā tathāgatassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti—
sn44.7:4.10.eng: That’s why, when asked, he does not declare one of those answers to be true.”

sn44.7:4.12.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇātipī”ti.

sn44.7:5.1.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.7:5.1.eng: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta got up from his seat and went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.7:5.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.7:5.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side. He asked the Buddha the same questions, and received the same answers.

sn44.7:5.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, bho gotama, sassato loko”ti?

sn44.7:5.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho gotama, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?

sn44.7:5.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.7:6.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo, yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.7:6.3.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā?

sn44.7:6.4.pli: Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo, yena bhoto gotamassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.7:6.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti?

sn44.7:7.1.pli: “Aññatitthiyā kho, vaccha, paribbājakā cakkhuṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti …pe…

sn44.7:7.2.pli: jivhaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti …pe…

sn44.7:7.3.pli: manaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassanti.

sn44.7:7.4.pli: Tasmā aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.7:7.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā.

sn44.7:7.7.pli: Tathāgato ca kho, vaccha, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho cakkhuṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…

sn44.7:7.8.pli: jivhaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati …pe…

sn44.7:7.9.pli: manaṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti samanupassati.

sn44.7:7.10.pli: Tasmā tathāgatassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.7:7.11.pli: ‘sassato loko’tipi, ‘asassato loko’tipi, ‘antavā loko’tipi, ‘anantavā loko’tipi, ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’tipi, ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’tipi, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti.

sn44.7:8.1.eng: He said, “It’s incredible, worthy Gotama, it’s amazing!

sn44.7:8.2.pli: Yatra hi nāma satthu ca sāvakassa ca atthena attho byañjanena byañjanaṃ saṃsandissati samessati na virodhayissati, yadidaṃ aggapadasmiṃ.
sn44.7:8.2.eng: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!

sn44.7:8.3.pli: Idānāhaṃ, bho gotama, samaṇaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṃ apucchiṃ.
sn44.7:8.3.eng: Just now I went to the ascetic Mahāmoggallāna and asked him about this matter.

sn44.7:8.4.pli: Samaṇopi me moggallāno etehi padehi etehi byañjanehi tamatthaṃ byākāsi, seyyathāpi bhavaṃ gotamo.
sn44.7:8.4.eng: And he explained it to me with these words and phrases, just like the worthy Gotama.

sn44.7:8.5.pli: Acchariyaṃ, bho gotama, abbhutaṃ, bho gotama.
sn44.7:8.5.eng: It’s incredible, worthy Gotama, it’s amazing!

sn44.7:8.6.pli: Yatra hi nāma satthu ca sāvakassa ca atthena attho byañjanena byañjanaṃ saṃsandissati samessati na virodhayissati, yadidaṃ aggapadasmin”ti.
sn44.7:8.6.eng: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!”

sn44.8:1.1.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.8:1.1.eng: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.8:1.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.8:1.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

sn44.8:1.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, bho gotama, sassato loko”ti?
sn44.8:1.3.eng: “Worthy Gotama, is this right: ‘the cosmos is eternal’?”

sn44.8:1.4.eng: “This has not been declared by me, Vaccha.” …

sn44.8:1.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho gotama, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?
sn44.8:1.5.eng: “Then is this right: ‘a realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death’?”

sn44.8:1.6.eng: “This too has not been declared by me.”

sn44.8:1.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.8:2.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:
sn44.8:2.1.eng: “What’s the cause, worthy Gotama, what’s the reason why, when the wanderers of other religions are asked these questions, they declare one of these to be true?

sn44.8:2.3.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā?

sn44.8:2.4.pli: Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yena bhoto gotamassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:
sn44.8:2.4.eng: And what’s the reason why, when the worthy Gotama is asked these questions, he does not declare one of these to be true?”

sn44.8:2.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti?

sn44.8:3.1.pli: “Aññatitthiyā kho, vaccha, paribbājakā rūpaṃ attato samanupassanti, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
sn44.8:3.1.eng: “Vaccha, the wanderers of other religions regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.

sn44.8:3.5.pli: viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassanti, viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
sn44.8:3.5.eng: consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.

sn44.8:3.6.pli: Tasmā aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:
sn44.8:3.6.eng: That’s why, when asked, they declare one of those answers to be true.

sn44.8:3.8.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā.

sn44.8:3.9.pli: Tathāgato ca kho, vaccha, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
sn44.8:3.9.eng: The Realized One doesn’t regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.

sn44.8:3.13.pli: na viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, na viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā viññāṇaṃ, na viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
sn44.8:3.13.eng: consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.

sn44.8:3.14.pli: Tasmā tathāgatassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:
sn44.8:3.14.eng: That’s why, when asked, he does not declare one of those answers to be true.”

sn44.8:3.16.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti.

sn44.8:4.1.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako uṭṭhāyāsanā yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahāmoggallānena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.8:4.1.eng: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta got up from his seat and went to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.8:4.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.8:4.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side. He asked Mahāmoggallāna the same questions, and received the same answers.

sn44.8:4.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, bho moggallāna, sassato loko”ti?

sn44.8:4.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho moggallāna, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?

sn44.8:4.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

sn44.8:5.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bho moggallāna, hetu, ko paccayo, yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.8:5.3.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā?

sn44.8:5.4.pli: Ko pana, bho moggallāna, hetu, ko paccayo yena samaṇassa gotamassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.8:5.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti?

sn44.8:6.1.pli: “Aññatitthiyā kho, vaccha, paribbājakā rūpaṃ attato samanupassanti, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.

sn44.8:6.5.pli: viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassanti, viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.

sn44.8:6.6.pli: Tasmā aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ evaṃ puṭṭhānaṃ evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.8:6.8.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vā.

sn44.8:6.9.pli: Tathāgato ca kho, vaccha, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.

sn44.8:6.13.pli: na viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, na viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā viññāṇaṃ, na viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.

sn44.8:6.14.pli: Tasmā tathāgatassa evaṃ puṭṭhassa na evaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti:

sn44.8:6.15.pli: ‘sassato loko’tipi, ‘asassato loko’tipi, ‘antavā loko’tipi, ‘anantavā loko’tipi, ‘taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīran’tipi, ‘aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīran’tipi, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipī”ti.

sn44.8:7.1.eng: He said, “It’s incredible, worthy Moggallāna, it’s amazing.

sn44.8:7.2.pli: Yatra hi nāma satthu ca sāvakassa ca atthena attho byañjanena byañjanaṃ saṃsandissati, samessati, na virodhayissati, yadidaṃ aggapadasmiṃ.
sn44.8:7.2.eng: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!

sn44.8:7.3.pli: Idānāhaṃ, bho moggallāna, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṃ apucchiṃ.
sn44.8:7.3.eng: Just now I went to the ascetic Gotama and asked him about this matter.

sn44.8:7.4.pli: Samaṇopi me gotamo etehi padehi etehi byañjanehi etamatthaṃ byākāsi, seyyathāpi bhavaṃ moggallāno.
sn44.8:7.4.eng: And he explained it to me with these words and phrases, just like the worthy Moggallāna.

sn44.8:7.5.pli: Acchariyaṃ, bho moggallāna, abbhutaṃ, bho moggallāna.
sn44.8:7.5.eng: It’s incredible, worthy Moggallāna, it’s amazing!

sn44.8:7.6.pli: Yatra hi nāma satthu ca sāvakassa ca atthena attho byañjanena byañjanaṃ saṃsandissati samessati na virodhayissati, yadidaṃ aggapadasmin”ti.
sn44.8:7.6.eng: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!”

sn44.9:1.1.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn44.9:1.1.eng: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

sn44.9:1.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn44.9:1.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

sn44.9:2.1.pli: “Purimāni, bho gotama, divasāni purimatarāni sambahulānaṃ nānātitthiyānaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kutūhalasālāyaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
sn44.9:2.1.eng: “Worthy Gotama, a few days ago several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who follow various other religions were sitting together in the debating hall, and this discussion came up among them:

sn44.9:2.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho pūraṇo kassapo saṅghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
sn44.9:2.2.eng: ‘This Pūraṇa Kassapa leads an order and a community, and tutors a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, deemed holy by many people.

sn44.9:2.3.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
sn44.9:2.3.eng: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

sn44.9:2.4.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:2.5.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tampi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
sn44.9:2.5.eng: And as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he also declares that

sn44.9:2.6.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:3.2.eng: the Jain ascetic of the Ñātika clan …

sn44.9:3.5.pli: ayampi kho ajito kesakambalo saṅghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
sn44.9:3.5.eng: Ajita of the hair blanket leads an order and a community, and tutors a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, deemed holy by many people.

sn44.9:3.6.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
sn44.9:3.6.eng: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

sn44.9:3.7.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:3.8.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tampi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
sn44.9:3.8.eng: And as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he also declares that

sn44.9:3.9.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:4.1.pli: Ayampi kho samaṇo gotamo saṅghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
sn44.9:4.1.eng: This ascetic Gotama leads an order and a community, and tutors a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, deemed holy by many people.

sn44.9:4.2.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
sn44.9:4.2.eng: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

sn44.9:4.3.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:4.4.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tañca sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu na byākaroti:
sn44.9:4.4.eng: But as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he doesn’t declare that

sn44.9:4.5.eng: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

sn44.9:4.6.pli: Api ca kho naṃ evaṃ byākaroti:
sn44.9:4.6.eng: Rather, he declares that they have

sn44.9:4.7.pli: ‘acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassā’ti.
sn44.9:4.7.eng: cut off craving, cast off the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit have made an end of suffering.’

sn44.9:4.8.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bho gotama, ahu deva kaṅkhā, ahu vicikicchā:
sn44.9:4.8.eng: I had doubt and uncertainty about that:

sn44.9:4.9.eng: ‘How on earth can I understand the ascetic Gotama’s teaching?’”

sn44.9:5.1.eng: “Vaccha, no wonder you’re doubting and uncertain.

sn44.9:5.2.pli: Kaṅkhanīye ca pana te ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā.
sn44.9:5.2.eng: Doubt has come up in you about an uncertain matter.

sn44.9:5.3.pli: Saupādānassa khvāhaṃ, vaccha, upapattiṃ paññāpemi no anupādānassa.
sn44.9:5.3.eng: I describe rebirth for someone who has fuel for grasping, not for someone who does not.

sn44.9:5.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, vaccha, aggi saupādāno jalati, no anupādāno;
sn44.9:5.4.eng: It’s like a fire which only burns with fuel, not without fuel.

sn44.9:5.5.pli: evameva khvāhaṃ, vaccha, saupādānassa upapattiṃ paññāpemi, no anupādānassā”ti.
sn44.9:5.5.eng: In the same way I describe rebirth for someone who grasps fuel, not for someone who doesn’t grasp fuel.”

sn44.9:6.1.pli: “Yasmiṃ, bho gotama, samaye acci vātena khittā dūrampi gacchati, imassa pana bhavaṃ gotamo kiṃ upādānasmiṃ paññāpetī”ti?
sn44.9:6.1.eng: “But when a flame is blown away by the wind, what does the worthy Gotama say is its fuel then?”

sn44.9:6.2.pli: “Yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye acci vātena khittā dūrampi gacchati, tamahaṃ vātūpādānaṃ paññāpemi.
sn44.9:6.2.eng: “At such a time, I say that it’s fueled by the wind.

sn44.9:6.3.pli: Vāto hissa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī”ti.
sn44.9:6.3.eng: For the wind is its fuel then.”

sn44.9:6.4.pli: “Yasmiñca pana, bho gotama, samaye imañca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, satto ca aññataraṃ kāyaṃ anupapanno hoti, imassa pana bhavaṃ gotamo kiṃ upādānasmiṃ paññāpetī”ti?
sn44.9:6.4.eng: “But when someone who is attached has laid down this body and has not been reborn in one of the realms, what does the worthy Gotama say is their fuel then?”

sn44.9:6.5.pli: “Yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye imañca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, satto ca aññataraṃ kāyaṃ anupapanno hoti, tamahaṃ taṇhūpādānaṃ vadāmi.
sn44.9:6.5.eng: “When someone who is attached has laid down this body, Vaccha, and has not been reborn in one of the realms, I say they’re fueled by craving.

sn44.9:6.6.pli: Taṇhā hissa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī”ti.
sn44.9:6.6.eng: For craving is their fuel then.”
